title: Kanye's Yeezy threat sends Gap shares falling
description: Kanye West's threat to walk away from his fashion company's fledgling partnership with the Gap has sent shares sharply lower.

title: Veteran who was hit by authorities in viral video speaks out
description: Chris David, a Navy veteran who was struck by unmarked officers in Portland during a protest, speaks to CNN's Brianna Keilar. CNN has reached out to the US Marshals and has not heard back.

title: Trump's 'law and order' is starting to look like martial law
description: The strange and frightening images of unidentified military-looking men taking protesters off the streets of Portland, Oregon, and into unmarked vans may be headed to a city near you if that city is, as President Donald Trump declared Monday, run by "liberal Democrats."

title: Mother who lost 2 kids to coronavirus: Take this seriously
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar speaks with Monete Hicks, who lost both her son and daughter to the coronavirus within a span of 11 days, and her niece Darisha Scott.

title: Scientists trace back strange behavior in South Atlantic magnetic field 11 million years
description: In case this was on your 2020 list of worries, the Earth's magnetic field is not about to reverse itself.

title: Most polar bears could struggle to survive in the Arctic by 2100, study finds
description: For many people, there is one animal that comes to mind when they think of creatures threatened by climate change: the polar bear.

title: Cocaine-filled coffee beans seized by police
description: Police in Italy discovered 130 grams of cocaine stuffed in over 500 beans of coffee after opening a package addressed to a fictional movie mob boss.

title: Amber Heard says Johnny Depp 'threatened to kill me many times'
description: US actress Amber Heard has alleged in court that her ex-husband Johnny Depp threatened to kill her "many times," especially later in their relationship, UK's PA Media reported on Monday.

title: Frontline workers attacked for enforcing mask requirements
description: Frontline workers across the country are facing attacks from unruly customers as they try to enforce mask requirements. CNN's Pete Muntean reports.

title: Police find shipment of coffee beans stuffed with cocaine
description: Police in Italy discovered cocaine stuffed inside individually hollowed-out coffee beans, after opening a parcel addressed to a fictional Mafia boss from a Hollywood movie.

title: Lewis Hamilton criticizes Formula One for 'lacking leadership' in the fight against racism
description: Lewis Hamilton says Formula One must do more in the fight against racism as he criticized some of his rival drivers for not taking the issue seriously enough.

title: Son of federal judge killed after gunman opened fire at her home
description: The son of US District Court of New Jersey Judge Esther Salas has died after a gunman opened fire on her home Sunday, the top judge at the federal courthouse confirmed to CNN.

title: 20 of the world's best places for swimming
description: From isolated English beaches to plunge pools in the Costa Rican cloud forest. Icy ponds at five-star hotels in the heart of Peru to quiet riverbanks in the Japanese Alps.

title: Jack Ma's Ant Financial chooses China for its IPO
description: One of China's biggest tech firms has chosen to stay home for its blockbuster IPO, shunning Wall Street where Chinese companies are facing heightened scrutiny because of rising geopolitical tensions.

title: Denmark's controversial 'social experiment'
description: Muhammad Aslam loves his home -- an apartment in a low-rise public housing estate at the heart of the diverse and gentrifying Copenhagen neighborhood of Norrebro.

title: How this historic group of WWII women blazed a trail
description: The 6888th Central Postal Directory Battalion faced discrimination during their historic service in World War II. Three of the living servicewomen share their stories.

title: A ship fire could hinder the US Navy's Pacific fleet for years to come
description: A massive blaze aboard a billion-dollar US Navy warship has been extinguished after raging for four days -- but its effect might be felt across America's Pacific Fleet for years.

title: EU's future at stake as tempers fray at summit on recovery fund
description: EU leaders failed to agree on a huge economic rescue package during fractious talks over the weekend that were described as some of the most bitterly divided in years.

title: Petition calls on Trader Joe's to change 'racist packaging'
description: More than 1,700 people have signed a petition urging Trader Joe's to change the labeling of some of its international food products, calling the grocery chain's branding "racist."

title: Hundreds of demonstrators, some wearing masks, protest against mask-wearing in London
description: Hundreds of demonstrators gathered in London on Sunday to protest against the wearing of face masks, days before it becomes mandatory to wear face coverings in stores in England.

title: NFL stars raise fears over NFL's coronavirus safety protocols
description: A number of the NFL's leading players have raised their concerns over the league's Covid-19 safety protocols as teams prepare to start training camps ahead of the season.

title: US cities hit hard by Covid-19 weigh another stay-at-home order
description: Some cities hit hard by Covid-19 are warning more drastic measures could lie ahead as officials try to contain a virus spreading more rampant than ever.

title: This could have predicted deadly volcano
description: Scientists in New Zealand have invented an alert system to provide warnings ahead of volcanic eruptions -- a system which, they say, could have predicted 2019's deadly White Island blast.

title: Hong Kong's stock market sees its future in Chinese tech
description: Hong Kong is launching a new Nasdaq-like technology index. It's a sign that the Asian financial hub, caught in a battle for its future between East and West — is prepared to embrace its role as a gateway for China's tech industry to the world.

title: Keanu Reeves is writing comic books -- the first issue is out in October
description: Actor, musician, film producer and, now, comic-book writer. Is there anything Keanu Reeves can't do?

title: China's movie theaters are back in business
description: China's massive box office began to reopen on Monday after the coronavirus pandemic spurred a shutdown lasting roughly six months.

title: Video shows animals trying to escape from flooding amid destruction in Asia
description: Widespread flooding caused by continuous heavy monsoon rains have been ravaging Asia: Home and farms are under water in Bangladesh and India; Banks of China's main river are under strain. CNN's Paula Hancocks reports.

title: Sweden pays human and economic price for not locking down
description: Sweden's soft approach to the coronavirus pandemic has been controversial as the country opted against locking down to protect the economy. However, Sweden hasn't been spared from great economic pain. CNN's Phil Black reports.

title: Lionel Messi claims record-breaking seventh golden boot
description: Lionel Messi continues to ruthlessly tear through the record books.

title: Trump insists he's 'right' on the virus as more Americans get sick and die
Why North Korea says it's joining the coronavirus vaccine race
description: North Korea says it is joining the race to develop a Covid-19 vaccine, a global contest that has already drafted in some of the world's best medical minds and is shaping up to cost billions of dollars.

title: Protests in Portland have carried on for more than 50 days. Here's how they started
description: For more than fifty days, protests in Portland have carried on. While many have been peaceful, those demonstrations have also been marked by violence, vandalism, arson, arrests and allegations of police brutality.

title: The US President made it clear that it's more important to him to be proven right about the pandemic than to reconsider his disastrous approach
description:
• Why top health officials changed their minds about face masks
• Trump gets fact-checked -- face to face
• Latest on the coronavirus: No ICU beds available at 49 Florida hospitals

title: City that had no Covid-19 cases now declared 'wartime' state
description: A "wartime" state has been declared in the capital of Xinjiang, home to China's persecuted Muslim-majority Uyghur ethnic group, as authorities implement strict and sweeping measures to stem a spike in coronavirus cases.

title: Amsterdam's 'prostitute hotel' plan to uproot red light district
description: When the Netherlands introduced lockdown measures in mid-March, Amsterdam's Red Light District transformed into a ghost town overnight. Coronavirus dealt a devastating blow to the Dutch capital's notorious window brothels and left over 300 legally operating sex workers without an income for almost four months.

title: Malaysia finds 1,800 tonnes of illegal toxic waste dumped at port
description: Malaysia has discovered 110 containers of illegally dumped toxic waste in what authorities are calling "the biggest finding of its kind" in the country's history, according to state media Bernama.

title: Analysis: How low can Donald Trump go?
description: With just 107 days until the 2020 election, it will be here before you know it. Every Sunday, I will outline the 5 BIG storylines you need to know to understand the upcoming week on the campaign trail. And they're ranked -- so the No. 1 story is the most important of the coming week.

title: Delta announces new health screenings for passengers who can't wear masks
description: Delta Air Lines will now require medical screenings for passengers who can't wear face masks due to health reasons — and asks that they reconsider flying altogether as the coronavirus pandemic rages.

title: The UAE has successfully launched the Arab world's first Mars mission
description: The United Arab Emirates successfully launched its Mars-bound Hope Probe on Sunday, marking the the Arab world's first interplanetary mission -- and the first of three international missions to the Red Planet this summer.

title: One dead, eight others injured in DC shooting
description: One person has died and eight others were injured in a shooting in Washington, DC, on Sunday afternoon, police said.

title: Dominique Fung upends the objectification of Asian women in surreal paintings
description: In Dominique Fung's paintings, baby blue hues dance with pastel pinks to create, at first glance, playful fantasies with Asian motifs. Like the works of Jean-Auguste-Dominique Ingres and Jean-Léon Gérôme, Fung's scenes entice with nude women reclining among porcelain vessels. However, closer inspection reveals stray knives, impaled fruit and dismembered limbs; the mirage dematerializes.

title: Seven things you probably didn't know were connected to slavery
description: As protesters across the United States continue calling for an end to police brutality and racial injustice, organizations are coming to terms with their racist histories.

title: See pup's heart-stopping close call on busy interstate
description: While attending to a multi-vehicle crash on I-495, emergency personnel scrambled to chase down a dog named Astro that belonged to one of the people involved in the accident. CNN affiliate WJLA reports.

title: She works as a dishwasher to see her husband amid Covid-19
description: Mary Daniel took a job as a dishwasher at her husband's senior care facility when coronavirus safety precautions put an end to visitations, and she tells CNN's Fredricka Whitfield the idea struck her at the beginning of the pandemic.
